title: Field to Fork 2019: Best Management Practices to Produce More Potatoes

tasks.task: Familiarize with potato cultivation practices and plant breeding.
subtasks: Recognize potato's botanical family and relation to other solanaceae plants.
Understand potato as a modified stem used for underground tubers.
Identify potato's country of origin and variety classification.
Note market classes of potatoes: round whites, long russets, reds, and specialties.
Recall potato's nutritional benefits and glycemic index considerations.
Acknowledge North Dakota's position in potato production.
Understand potato's climate and soil preferences.
Differentiate between asexual and true potato seed propagation.
Determine proper planting time and spacing for garden potatoes.
Evaluate fertilization needs and timing for optimal potato growth.
Assess weed and pest management strategies in home gardens.
Recognize common potato diseases, physiological disorders, and defensive measures.
